DOC.HEAD: Summary of Events
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Here is a brief summary of events Saturday in Romania: _Revolutionary leaders announce the capture of President Nicolae Ceausescu, his wife, Elena, who is the deputy premier, and the third ranking leader, Emil Bobu. The new provisional government said they will be put on trial. _The revolutionaries say they control the country, but sporadic fighting continues. Skirmishes continue in the capital between army units siding with pro-reform protesters and security forces loyal to the deposed Ceausescu. Much of the fighting appears to be guerrilla warfare by loyalist forces desperate to avoid capture. _Anti-Ceausescu forces catch and kill loyalists on the spot. An AP reporter witnesses summary executions near the Bucharest post office. _The Soviet Union, the International Red Cross, Britain, France, Sweden and numerous other nations announce plans to ship crucial medical and food supplies to the embattled nation. But they report difficulty in bypassing blockades at the border. _Romanian embassies worldwide shift their allegiances to the new government. Diplomatic missions in Washington, Iran, the Netherlands, Libya, the Soviet Union, Jordan, Sweden, Turkey, Greece, Poland, Sudan and many others announce support for the new leadership. _Citizens waving flags and cheering the revolution venture out into the streets, despite the fighting. Taxis are commandeered to carry bodies in Bucharest, and residents carry knives and sharp sticks to defend against attacks by pro-Ceausescu forces in the city of Timisoara.
